definition: soup/hot or boiling water/decoction of medicinal herbs/water in which sth has been boiled

sentences.english: A medicinal infusion, such as sweetened barley water.
sentences.chinese: 湯劑藥物浸劑，比如加糖的大麥湯。

sentences.english: Objective To compare differences of pharmacodynamics from compatible granule and traditional decoction of Lizhongtang.
sentences.chinese: 目的進行理中湯配方顆粒與湯劑的藥效學比較。

sentences.english: Conclusion The quality of decoction extracted by high pressure CMM extructor is good.
sentences.chinese: 結論高壓煎藥機所煎湯劑質量較好。

sentences.english: Objective To study on quality of decoction extracted by normal and high pressure Chinese Materia Medica (CMM) extructor.
sentences.chinese: 目的考察常壓與高壓煎藥機制備中藥湯劑的質量優劣。

sentences.english: Objective To investigate the effect of expression on the quality of decoction of traditional Chinese medicine.
sentences.chinese: 目的研究中藥的壓榨處理對湯劑質量的影響。

sentences.english: The amount of Da Huang used and its related method in decoctions were also investigated.
sentences.chinese: 大黃的三種湯劑煎煮法也有不同程度的側重。

sentences.english: The chinese medicine of the soup were provided by the Changchun Chinese medicine University affiliated hospital.
sentences.chinese: 自擬湯劑用藥由長春中醫藥大學附屬醫院提供。

definition: (in Chinese medicine) stasis (of blood or other fluids)
to course the liver and rectify 氣|气[qi4] (TCM)
to take a tonic or nourishing food to build up one's health
treatment involving the use of tonics to restore the patient's health/reinforcing method (in acupuncture)
